article:
One of the most common social fears is that we are not good enough. Perhaps you feel you won't   _  others
because they are more confident, successful, intelligent or attractive than
you. Such thinking is misguided. The  _  of doing
well is accepting yourself as you are.
When I was a student, I kept a diary filled with  _  memories. Some were painful memories from  _  when I felt hurt, confused, lonely and insecure. I  _  pieces of dreams and personal feelings of anger and hatred,  as well as  things I enjoyed such as magic shops and coin dealers.
Then a terrible thing happened.   _  dinner one night I realized I had left my diary in the cloakroom outside the campus dining hall.   _  that somebody might read it and find out the truth about me, I  _  back, but it was gone.
Weeks passed, and eventually I gave up hope of ever finding it   _  . A month later, I was 46 _ up my jacket in the same place when I saw my brown  _  diary, just where I'd left it.
  _   I read through the pages and found that a   _  had written the following, "God bless you. I'm  a lot  like you, only I  _  keep a diary, and
I'm  _  to know there are others like me. I hope
things turn out well for you."
Tears came to my eyes. I had never thought that any one could know my inner feelings and also   _  things
just like the way I did.
No matter what you are like, whether you're rich or poor, brilliant or   _  , attractive or plain,
there are people like you. Get rid of your fears of not being good enough, and  _  yourself as you are.
